dt: {bc}having lost faith or trust in something formerly regarded as good or valuable

dt.t: becoming more and more {wi}disillusioned{/wi} with politics
Overworked, tired, {wi}disillusioned{/wi}, with a shaky marriage, the district attorney finally gets a case that he really wants to prosecute.
The camps grew restive and {wi}disillusioned{/wi}, but refused to give up.
The {wi}disillusioned{/wi} children of troubled marriages suffer from their parents' transgressions long into adulthood.

shortdef: having lost faith or trust in something formerly regarded as good or valuable

dt: {bc}to cause to lose {d_link|naive|naive} faith and trust

dt.t: The job {wi}disillusioned{/wi} her about working in retail.

shortdef: to free from illusion; also : to cause to lose naive faith and trust
